### getOccupancyWithWorkGroupSizes() {#a0d3af39660fba65e1eb9f861b6e94822}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; unsigned, unsigned &gt; AMDGPUSubtarget::getOccupancyWithWorkGroupSizes (uint32&#95;t LDSBytes, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F) const</>}>
Subtarget&#39;s minimum/maximum occupancy, in number of waves per EU, that can be achieved when the only function running on a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/cu">CU</a> is <code>F</code> and each workgroup running the function requires <code>LDSBytes</code> bytes of LDS space.

This notably depends on the range of allowed flat group sizes for the function and hardware characteristics.

  prototype={<>std::pair&lt; unsigned, unsigned &gt; AMDGPUSubtarget::getOccupancyWithWorkGroupSizes (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF) const</>}>
Subtarget&#39;s minimum/maximum occupancy, in number of waves per EU, that can be achieved when the only function running on a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/cu">CU</a> is <code>MF</code>.

This notably depends on the range of allowed flat group sizes for the function, the amount of per-workgroup LDS space required by the function, and hardware characteristics.

### getWavesPerEU() {#a3861ef4f23f9a124d85adbdd063dab9c}

  labels = {["inline"]}>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
Subtarget&#39;s default pair of minimum/maximum number of waves per execution unit for function <code>F</code>, or minimum/maximum number of waves per execution unit explicitly requested using &quot;amdgpu-waves-per-eu&quot; attribute attached to function <code>F</code>.
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="Returns">
Subtarget&#39;s default values if explicitly requested values cannot be converted to integer, violate subtarget&#39;s specifications, or are not compatible with minimum/maximum number of waves limited by flat work group size, register usage, and/or lds usage.
</SectionUser>

Return true if real (non-fake) variants of True16 instructions using 16-bit registers should be code-generated.
